generalInfo: Welcome to your Mexican adventure! This journey has been specially designed around one of the world’s most extraordinary natural phenomena: the Monarch Butterfly migration. Along the way, you’ll also experience the best of Mexico’s culture, history, and landscapes — from colonial towns and archaeological sites to turquoise lagoons and vibrant markets. Whether you’re marveling at millions of butterflies in the forests of Valle de Bravo, exploring ancient ruins, or simply soaking in the atmosphere of a lively plaza, each day will bring new discoveries. Get ready for a trip full of wonder, color, and unforgettable experiences.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Mexico City, the capital and largest city in Mexico, recognized for its rich history and culture that combines its pre-Hispanic, colonial and present times to offer travelers an endless number of places to visit and a varied gastronomy. A free day in Mexico City is a perfect opportunity to explore the cultural, gastronomic, historical and artistic diversity of this vibrant city. Some of the areas you could visit are the Historic Center, the bohemian neighborhoods of La Condesa and La Roma, the exclusive neighborhood of Polanco or the historic Coyoacán, each with a great offer of museums, gastronomy and options to live a great day in this vibrant city. Today, you will have a gastronomic experience at the Tezontle restaurant that is part of the Casa de la Luz hotel. A restaurant that, through its chefs from Oaxaca, seeks to offer a wide variety of culinary options using local and seasonal ingredients. On this occasion you will be able to taste the Milpa menu which is made up of: artichoke with breezes, pot beans, huitlacoche soup, chinampa salad, tomatoes and quesillo, green gold tlayuda, cottage cheese tetela in green pipian, flower and pumpkin, rice pudding, corn with rompope. The experience ends at the end of the menu. Note: Experience not available on Sundays. included : CDMX APT - Hotel in Z. Centro or Paseo de la Reforma (Private Service) / Milpa Menu - 2h - ENG (Private Service) welcome drink - 2pm to 4 pm, 7pm to 8pm / 1 Night at Mexico City : Junior Suite - 1 king cama Casa de la Luz A la carte breakfast /

Mexico City is a vibrant and culturally rich city with a fascinating history dating back to pre-Columbian times. The city is famous for its impressive architecture, which includes ancient Aztec ruins and colonial-era buildings, as well as modern skyscrapers. The city is also home to numerous museums, art galleries and cultural centers that showcase Mexico's rich cultural heritage. Another highlight is its delicious cuisine, which ranges from tacos and tamales to haute cuisine restaurants. Today you will have a guided tour of approximately 5 hours. First you will visit the Museum of Anthropology, one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960s by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal. Your second stop of the day will be the majestic Chapultepec Castle surrounded by a forest of the same name, one of the largest green areas of the Aztec capital. You will start with a walk through the forest and then start climbing up to the castle located at the top of the hill. The castle was built in 1785 as the residence of the viceroy of New Spain and was later remodeled to be the home of Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota. In 1939 it became the National Museum of History with a magnificent collection of historical pieces and murals with interpretations of the history of Mexico. From the top there are beautiful views of the forest and the city. Afterwards a private transfer will take you from Casa de la luz to your new accommodation in Valle de Bravo! included : Anthropology Museum & Chapultepec Castle - 5h - ENG (Private Service) Transport, guide / 4 Nights at Valle de Bravo: Hotel Misión Grand Valle de Bravo Master Suite - 1 king bed Water / CDMX - Valle de Bravo - 2 bags 25 kg - 2h20min (Private Service)

Good Morning Valle de Bravo! Welcome to the charming lakeside town tucked away in the mountains of central Mexico. Known for its cobblestone streets, whitewashed houses with terracotta roofs, and the sparkling Lake Avándaro, Valle de Bravo blends natural beauty with rich culture. Whether you’re drawn to outdoor adventures like paragliding and hiking, peaceful boat rides on the lake, or simply strolling through its vibrant plazas and markets, this destination offers something special for every traveler.

Begin your Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary tour with an early pick-up from your accommodation and journey into the oyamel forests of Michoacán and the State of Mexico. From November to March, millions of Monarchs migrate here, creating a magical spectacle as they blanket the trees in orange and black. Your guide will share insights into their migration and conservation efforts as you witness this awe-inspiring natural wonder up close. After the sanctuary, continue on to Valle de Bravo, a colonial town by Lake Avándaro. Stroll through cobblestone streets, admire historic architecture, and explore vibrant markets. Along the way, enjoy authentic local food, from tacos and tamales to artisanal ice cream made with fresh fruits. With its mix of culture, history, and stunning scenery, Valle de Bravo offers the perfect ending before returning to Mexico City. included : Maison Grand Valle - Meeting point of the Monarch Butterfly Mexico Sanctuary: Piedra Herrada Tour (Pick Up & Drop Off) / Monarch Butterfly Mexico Sanctuary: Piedra Herrada Tour (Private Service) Transporte, Guide, Snacks, Drinks (non alcoholic), Entrance Fee

From the depths of Temoanchan, the sacred place of the ancestors, souls return in the form of butterflies. Join this approximately 5-hour journey accompanied by your local English-speaking guide to witness the journey of the monarch butterflies from Canada to our country. Discover their extraordinary evolution and the challenges they face to survive a journey.This unique experience is only available during the months of November to March, when the monarch butterflies arrive to this territory in search of refuge. Venture out during this period and witness the beauty and fragility of these creatures that embody the ancestral spirit and the connection between the earthly and spiritual worlds. included : Monarch butterfly watching - 5h - ENG (Private Service) Guide, Lunch, Entrance - 11am / Maison Grand Valle - Meeting Point for Monarch butterfly watching (Pick Up & Drop Off)

Today we are saying goodbye to Valle de Bravo, and a private transfer will take you back to Mexico City, where you’ll settle into your new accommodation. Tonight, your local English-speaking guide and a small group of travelers will pick you up for a 3-hour gastronomic experience in the streets of the Aztec capital. Narvarte is known throughout Mexico City for its tacos, and you'll begin the tour with a visit to a neighborhood taqueria that specializes in volcanes, a type of crispy tortilla cooked over a charcoal flame, topped with cheese and poblano peppers. From there, you'll sample tacos al pastor (imagine a large outdoor grill, flames lit) and suadero tacos from vendors who have been in the neighborhood for decades. You'll visit a lively cantina to learn more about Mexico City's cantina culture, where you'll sip a cold beer or cocktail if you wish. You'll continue on to sample a flight of small-batch artisanal mezcals at a cozy neighborhood restaurant as part of a private mezcal tasting led by a local chef and expert. included : Narvarte at night: Tacos, chelas and mezcal - 3h - ENG (Shared Service) Transport, Guide, Food, Drinks - 7pm, 7:30pm / Valle de Bravo - CDMX - 2 bags 25 kg - 2h27min (Private Service) / 1 Night at Mexico City : Terrace Suite - 1 king cama Hotel Condesa DF Continental breakfast

We hope you enjoyed your time in Valle de Bravo, from the lake views to the colonial charm of the town. As you return to Mexico City, take with you the memories of this special place and the experiences that made your journey unforgettable. Safe travels and hasta pronto! included : Hotel in Z.
